item.title: PowerCLI: Getting cluster alarms
item.description: The next step in my short series on getting vCenter alarms using PowerCLI is to get cluster alarms. Here’s the code: And the output will look something like this: As you can see, this will also list vm alarms and host alarms. So you could argue that you only need this and not separate scripts/functions for getting vm alarms and host alarms. Anyways, here’s the function code: The output will be the same, but since it’s a function you can manipulate the data further.
